configuration.name: code
configuration.value:
# Import required libraries
from pyspark.ml.feature import VectorAssembler, StopWordsRemover, Tokenizer, CountVectorizer, IDF
from pyspark.ml.linalg import Vectors
from pyspark.ml import Pipeline, PipelineModel
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.ml.tuning import CrossValidator, ParamGridBuilder
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import MulticlassClassificationEvaluator
from pyspark.ml.classification import LogisticRegression
from pyspark.sql.types import FloatType

# Setup variables for convenience and readability 
trainSplit = 0.8
testSplit = 0.2
maxIter = 10
regParam = 0.3
elasticNetParam = 0.8
numberOfCVFolds = 3

# The input dataframe is accessbile via inputs[0]
df = inputs[0]

# Split dataset into "train" and "test" sets
(train, test) = df.randomSplit([trainSplit, testSplit], 42) 

tokenizer = Tokenizer(inputCol="text",outputCol="tokenized")
stopWordsRemover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol=tokenizer.getOutputCol(),outputCol="stopWordsRemoved")
countVectorizer = CountVectorizer(inputCol=stopWordsRemover.getOutputCol(),outputCol="countVectorized")
idf = IDF(inputCol=countVectorizer.getOutputCol(),outputCol="inverted")

# MUST for Spark features
assembler = VectorAssembler(inputCols=[idf.getOutputCol()], outputCol="features")

# LogisticRegression Model
lr = LogisticRegression(maxIter=maxIter, regParam=regParam, elasticNetParam=elasticNetParam)

# Setup pipeline -- pay attention to the order -- it matters!
pipeline = Pipeline(stages=[tokenizer, stopWordsRemover, countVectorizer, idf, assembler, lr])

# Setup evaluator -- default is F1 score
classEvaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(metricName="accuracy")

# Setup hyperparams grid
paramGrid = ParamGridBuilder().addGrid(lr.elasticNetParam,[0.0]).addGrid(countVectorizer.vocabSize,[5000]).build()

# Setup cross validator
cv = CrossValidator(estimator=pipeline, estimatorParamMaps=paramGrid, evaluator=classEvaluator, numFolds=numberOfCVFolds) 

# Fit model on "train" set
cvModel = cv.fit(train)

# Get the best model based on CrossValidator
model = cvModel.bestModel

# Run inference on "test" set
predictions = model.transform(test)

# Return accuray as output dataframe
accuracy = classEvaluator.evaluate(predictions)
output = spark.createDataFrame([accuracy], FloatType()).withColumnRenamed("value","Accuracy")

configDefinitions.label: Retry Attempts
configDefinitions.description: Max no of retries. To retry indefinitely, use -1. The wait time between retries starts at 15 seconds and doubles until reaching 5 minutes.
configDefinitions.name: retryAttempts

configDefinitions.label: Enable Ludicrous Mode
configDefinitions.description: Ludicrous mode may significantly improve performance, but metrics will be limited
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousMode

configDefinitions.label: Collect Input Metrics
configDefinitions.description: Collects and displays input metrics. Can result in rereading data unless origins are configured to cache data
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousModeInputCount

configDefinitions.label: Advanced Error Handling
configDefinitions.description: Reports the record that generates an error, when possible. Supported in single-origin pipelines
configDefinitions.name: advancedErrorHandling

configDefinitions.label: Notify on Pipeline State Changes
configDefinitions.description: Notifies via email when pipeline gets to the specified states
configDefinitions.name: notifyOnStates

configDefinitions.label: Email IDs

configDefinitions.label: Rate Limit (records / sec)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of records per second that should be accepted into the pipeline. Rate is not limited if this is not set, or is set to 0
configDefinitions.name: rateLimit

configDefinitions.label: Max runners
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of runners that should be created for this pipeline. Use 0 to not impose limit.
configDefinitions.name: maxRunners

configDefinitions.label: Create Failure Snapshot
configDefinitions.description: When selected and the pipeline execution fails with unrecoverable exception, SDC will attempt to createpartial snapshot with records that have not been processed yet.
configDefinitions.name: shouldCreateFailureSnapshot

configDefinitions.label: Runner Idle Time (sec)
configDefinitions.description: When pipeline runners are idle for at least this time, run an empty batch through the runner to process any events or other time-driven functionality. Value -1 will disable this functionality completely.
configDefinitions.name: runnerIdleTIme

stages.label: File
stages.description: Reads data from HDFS-compatible file systems

configDefinitions.label: File Name Pattern
configDefinitions.description: A glob that defines a pattern of file names to process
configDefinitions.name: configBean.fileNamePattern

configDefinitions.label: Exclusion Pattern
configDefinitions.description: A glob that defines a pattern of file names to exclude from processing
configDefinitions.name: configBean.fileNameExcludePattern

configDefinitions.label: Max Files Per Batch
configDefinitions.description: Limits the number of files to be processed in a single batch. Use 0 for unlimited.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.batchNumFileLimit

configDefinitions.label: Schema Mode
configDefinitions.description: Determines the schema to use when reading data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.schemaMode

configDefinitions.label: Schema
configDefinitions.description: Custom schema to use when parsing data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.customSchemaString

configDefinitions.label: Error Handling
configDefinitions.description: Behavior when data does not conform to the schema

labels: Permissive - Creates a record with null values, optionally places original data in a field
Drop Malformed - Drops the record from the pipeline

configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.parseErrorMode

configDefinitions.label: Original Data Field
configDefinitions.description: String field to contain the original record data when parsing errors occur. Include the field in the custom schema. When not used, the original data for error records is not captured.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.columnNameOfCorruptRecord

configDefinitions.label: Post Processing
configDefinitions.description: Action to take on successfully read files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.postProcessType

configDefinitions.label: Archive Directory
configDefinitions.description: Directory to store successfully read files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.archiveDir

configDefinitions.label: Includes Header
configDefinitions.description: Uses the first row of the first file to name record fields. Skips processing the first row of each file, assuming it is a header row.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.csvHeader

configDefinitions.label: Root Tag
configDefinitions.description: Root tag of the XML files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.rootTag

configDefinitions.label: Row Tag
configDefinitions.description: Tag used to identify each row
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.rowTag

configDefinitions.label: Multi-Line JSON
configDefinitions.description: Parse JSON in multi-line mode
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.multiLineJson

configDefinitions.label: Avro Schema
configDefinitions.description: The Avro schema (in JSON format) to use when reading data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.avroSchema

configDefinitions.label: Ignore extension
configDefinitions.description: If enabled, all files (not just those ending in .avro) are read
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.avroIgnoreExtension

configDefinitions.label: Directory Path
configDefinitions.description: Path to the directory to use
configDefinitions.name: configBean.path

configDefinitions.label: Data Format
configDefinitions.description: Format of the data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormat

configDefinitions.label: Additional Configuration
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties to pass to a Hadoop-compatible file system. These properties take precedence over those defined in HDFS configuration files.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.hdfsProperties

configDefinitions.label: Load Data Only Once
configDefinitions.description: Do not reload data every micro-batch in streaming mode. Has no effect in batch mode. Data will be cached on Spark executors
configDefinitions.name: noReload

configDefinitions.label: Cache Data
configDefinitions.description: If only a small amount of data is read from the source system due to pushdown of operators  from other stages, it might be beneficial to not cache. Caching will cause all data to be read once
configDefinitions.name: cache

configDefinitions.label: Skip Offset Tracking
configDefinitions.description: Do not track offsets between batches. Data will be completely reloaded from the source on  batch.
configDefinitions.name: skipOffsetTracking

stages.label: PySpark
stages.description: Runs PySpark code to transform each batch of data

configDefinitions.label: PySpark Code
configDefinitions.description: PySpark code used to transform the data
configDefinitions.name: code
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Important: Before using the PySpark processor, 
 # you must install Python and set the following environment 
# variables on the cluster where the pipeline runs or on the 
# Transformer machine for local pipelines: 

# export PYSPARK_PYTHON=<path-to-python3-binary>
# export PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON=<path-to-python3-binary>
# export PYTHONPATH=$SPARK_HOME/python/lib/py4j-<version>-src.zip:$SPARK_HOME/python:$SPARK_HOME/bin/pyspark:$PYTHONPATH

# If external Python libraries are required in the code, add Python's site-packages to PYTHONPATH, for example:
# export PYTHONPATH=$SPARK_HOME/python/lib/py4j-<version>-src.zip:$SPARK_HOME/python:$SPARK_HOME/bin/pyspark:<path-to-Python>/python<version>/site-packages:$PYTHONPATH

# Click the Help icon for additional details about these prerequisites.

# Use the inputs global array to access the input DataFrames. After performing transformations, 
# assign the transformed DataFrame to the output variable.

# For example, the following code imports the pyspark.sql.functions module, increments the value 
# field by 1, and then assigns the results to the output variable:

# from pyspark.sql.functions import col
# output = inputs[0].select((inputs[0].value + 1).alias('value'))

# The following code assigns the inputs[0] to the output variable without any change:
output = inputs[0]

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_spark_transform_py_PythonDTransform

configDefinitions.label: Partition by Fields
configDefinitions.description: List of fields to partition the data by. Leave empty to not partition.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.partitionByColumns

configDefinitions.label: Exclude Unrelated SCD Master Records
configDefinitions.description: Excludes records from the write that do not share a partition with any slowly changing dimension changes
configDefinitions.name: configBean.filterUnrelatedScdMasterRecords

configDefinitions.label: Include Header
configDefinitions.description: Includes field names as a header row
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.csvHeader

configDefinitions.label: Root Element
configDefinitions.description: Root element to use for the files. If not set, the destination uses <ROWS>.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.rootTag

configDefinitions.label: Record Element
configDefinitions.description: Element used to enclose each record. If not set, the destination uses <ROW>.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.rowTag

configDefinitions.label: Directory Path
configDefinitions.description: Path to the directory to use
configDefinitions.name: configBean.path

configDefinitions.label: Data Format

configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormat

configDefinitions.label: Additional Configuration
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties to pass to a Hadoop-compatible file system. These properties take precedence over those defined in HDFS configuration files.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.hdfsProperties
